etymology.description: 鼎 (“cauldron”) + 廾 (“two hands”) — to prepare food.
etymology.interpretation: Two hands lifting a cauldron evokes preparing or furnishing, which broadened to senses like ‘to equip/possess’ and to concrete ‘tools/implements.’ Shuowen misread the middle as 贝 and gave a currency-related gloss, but earlier forms show the hands-and-cauldron scene.

examples.chinese: 我具备完成任务的能力(我具備完成任務的能力)。
examples.pinyin: Wǒ jùbèi wánchéng rènwu de nénglì.
examples.english: I possess the ability to complete the task.

examples.chinese: 请准备好工具和防护器具(請準備好工具和防護器具)。
examples.pinyin: Qǐng zhǔnbèi hǎo gōngjù hé fánghù qìjù.
examples.english: Please prepare the tools and protective equipment.

examples.chinese: 这项研究具有重要的实际意义(這項研究具有重要的實際意義)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè xiàng yánjiū jùyǒu zhòngyào de shíjì yìyì.
examples.english: This study possesses important practical significance.
